meanings.definition: To discharge or pour forth contents
meanings.sent1: The river disgorges its water into the ocean.
meanings.sent2: The garbage truck disgorges its load at the landfill.
meanings.sent3: The overflowing cup suddenly disgorges its contents onto the table.
meanings.sent4: The volcano disgorges molten lava, painting the landscape in fiery hues.
meanings.sent5: The burst pipe disgorges a torrent of water, flooding the basement.

meanings.definition: To eject or throw out forcefully
meanings.sent1: The machine disgorges coins when you press the button.
meanings.sent2: The angry cat disgorges furballs when upset.
meanings.sent3: The magician's hat seems to magically disgorge endless scarves.
meanings.sent4: The storm disgorges hailstones, pelting the roof with icy projectiles.
meanings.sent5: The pressure washer disgorges a powerful stream of water, cleaning the deck efficiently.
